doc.after: The first major camp to be directly encountered by Allied troops, Majdanek, was discovered by the advancing Soviets on 23 July 1944. CheÅmno was liberated by the Soviets on 20 January 1945. Auschwitz was liberated, also by the Soviets, on 27 January 1945;[292] Buchenwald by the Americans on 11 April;[293] Bergen-Belsen by the British on 15 April;[294] Dachau by the Americans on 29 April;[295] RavensbrÃ¼ck by the Soviets on the same day; Mauthausen by the Americans on 5 May;[296] and Theresienstadt by the Soviets on 8 May.[297] Treblinka, SobibÃ³r, and BeÅÅ¼ec were never liberated, but were destroyed by the Nazis in 1943. Colonel William W. Quinn of the US 7th Army said of Dachau: "There our troops found sights, sounds, and stenches horrible beyond belief, cruelties so enormous as to be incomprehensible to the normal mind."[298][299]
